node.title: Kangaroo Island Mayor storms out of parliamentary inquiry after refusing to answer lawyer's questions
node.alt: A woman wearing a black blazer, white top and glasses sits in front of a microphone. She is holding a binder of papers
node.description: Describing it as a "complete circus", Michael Pengilly stormsÂ out of a parliamentary committee looking into Vickie Chapman's refusal of a port on Kangaroo Island.
node.content:
["Kangaroo Island Mayor Michael Pengilly\u00a0has sensationally stormed out of a parliamentary committee inquiry into Vickie Chapman's refusal of a port on the island.", "Earlier in the week, Planning Minister Ms Chapman told the committee Mr Pengilly was a \"family friend\" who invited her to a Parliament House meeting in 2018 with representatives from Kangaroo Island Plantation Timber.", "Today Mr Pengilly confirmed he and Ms Chapman,\u00a0who both own land on Kangaroo Island, asked the port proponents to explore other potential development sites.", "\"I can tell you the first meeting was in the members lounge, and \u2026 they came to brief myself and I asked Vickie Chapman as a landholder on the island to come along,\" Mr Pengilly said.", "\"You invited Ms Chapman to attend because she was a landholder on the island?\" counsel assisting the committee\u00a0Rachael Gray\u00a0QC asked.", "\"Yeah, is there something wrong with that?\" Mr Pengilly responded.", "\"We were both in opposition, she was a Member of Parliament and she had property on the island. I don't see anything unusual about that whatsoever.\"", "Dr Grey then asked Mr Pengilly if he recalled a discussion at the meeting in relation to the location of the proposed port.", "\"Yes, they told us they wanted to put a port at Smith Bay and they told us they bought the piece of land,\" he said.", "", "
Kangaroo Island Mayor Michael Pengilly described the inquiry as a \"complete circus\".(ABC News: Casey Briggs)
", "Mr Pengilly,\u00a0who was giving evidence via videolink,\u00a0then took issue with Dr\u00a0Gray asking him questions.", "When he asked who was asking the questions, committee chair Andrea Michaels told him Dr Gray was.", "\"She didn't introduce herself as asking questions.", "\"I will take no further questions from Mrs Gray or whatever her name is.\"", "Dr Gray proceeded to ask another question before being interrupted by Mr Pengilly.", "
Mayor owns land near proposed port site
", "The committee\u00a0previously heard Mr Pengilly owned\u00a0property near Smith Bay \u2014 where the port was proposed to be built \u2014 but he would not answer questions about the suggested truck route going past his home and if it was to be approved.", "\"I don't think you get it, Dr Gray.\u00a0It's about the port, not the roads,\" he said.", "\"Do you follow that?\"", "\"Mr Pengilly, do you accept that on the 2021 assessment report\u00a0your property was located on the road that was the truck route to be used into Smith Bay, should the proposal be approved?\" Dr Gray said.", "\"That is a lie,\" he replied.", "Dr Gray also\u00a0asked Mr Pengilly if his property overlooked\u00a0Smith Bay.", "\"I've got to say, Chair, I cannot be bothered with this.\u00a0I've got better things to do with my time,\" Mr Pengilly\u00a0said.", "\"If you want to ask me questions pertaining to the port application at Smith Bay alone, I'm fine to answer those, but I'm not putting up with this charade.\"", "Dr Gray asked if it was fair to say Mr Pengilly was \"opposed to the port at Smith Bay\", prompting him to leave the meeting.", "\"Chair, I intend to leave this meeting,\" he said", "\"It's very disappointing that you can't stick to the application so I'm sorry\u00a0but\u00a0goodbye.\"", "", "
Senior counsel assisting the committee Rachael Gray QC listens during the\u00a0hearing.(ABC News: Haidarr Jones)
", "The committee continues next week and will hand down a final report to the Speaker of the House of Assembly on November 18.", "
Premier 'stands by' deputy
", "Yesterday South Australia's Premier, Steven Marshall, said he stood \"shoulder-to-shoulder\" with his deputy as she faced\u00a0allegations of having a conflict of interest and misleading the parliament.", "\"Vickie Chapman has now been the subject of a very expensive mud-slinging exercise in the South Australian parliament,\" Mr Marshall said.", "\"I stand shoulder to shoulder with our Attorney-General. She does an outstanding job.\"", "\"I'm not going to participate in the kangaroo court which the Labor Party has set up to throw mud at the Attorney-General on the eve of an election.", "\"She has my 100 per cent support she made the right decision.\"", "Mr Marshall also said he believed\u00a0that although the port's refusal \"wasn't an easy decision\", it was the \"right decision\" for Kangaroo Island.", "\"We acknowledge the forestry is very important but we also know that agriculture, fishing and the fishing sector is very important and so is tourism,\" he said.", "\"All of those things need to be taken into account.\""]
